results.title: Relative strangers
results.brief_description:
Simon thought he knew his parents… A film about a family, a deception and its legacy.
The visual effects in this film were all camera-created, using a technique of projection onto a moving sheet to create the insubstantial and constantly changing images that reflect the perceptions of the narrator (Simon Cooper). Nothing in his world turned out to be what it first seemed.

group_siblings.title: One hundred a day
group_siblings.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Alan Marshall and AFTRS

results.title: One hundred a day
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Alan Marshall and AFTRS
results.brief_description: In this highly acclaimed short by the director of ‘My Brilliant Career’ (1979) and ‘Oscar and Lucinda’ (1997), a young girl is forced to continue working at her machine all day in a 1930s shoe factory after a visit to a backyard abortionist. Cast features Rosalie Fletcher, Eve Wynne, Jenee Walsh, Beth Child, Virginia Partingale, Sue Piggott. Based on the short story ‘How beautiful are thy feet’ by Alan Marshall. Original format 16mm/black and white.

results.title: The Two-wheeled time machine
results.creator_credit: David Lowe, Miriam Stein and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Henry Howard has discovered a way to stay young forever but life doesn’t seem worth living without his childhood sweetheart, Alice. Risking old age, Henry returns to convince her to join him.
Cast includes Matt Day as Henry, and Essie Davis as Alice (aged 19-35) and Jacki Weaver as Alice (49-76).

results.title: 3 things
results.brief_description: This humourous very short experimental film has a twist to it - it has three everyday things that will make you take a second look. Fun, quirky, different.

results.title: Backthenrightnowlateron
results.creator_credit: David Megarrity, Luke Monsour and Queensland Performing Arts Centre
results.brief_description:
Mixing interviews, images and tiny fictions, “Backthenrightnowlateron” is a funny and moving collection of children’s thoughts on their past, present and future.
The work is divided into three segments - Backthen, Rightnow, Lateron. Each segment features children from Class 2J, Yeronga State School, with their favourite toy sharing their thoughts with interviewer Georgia Seffrin, and a mini-film starring one of the toys - Chicky goes to nana’s house, Red Ted goes to England, Minotaur goes to war. Provides a wonderful and amusing insight into young children’s minds.
Developed from an original concept and commission by QPAC’s “Out of the Box” Festival of Early Childhood for the OOTB Symposium, September 2003.

results.title: Rabbit on the moon
results.brief_description:
Italians are the largest group of non Anglo Celtic migrants in Australia, totalling nearly one million people. Yet, like most of these migrants, they are either constantly misrepresented or not represented at all on Australian screens.
Australia, 1971. “Rabbit on the moon” is a fairy tale about a northern Italian girl growing up in suburban Australia as seven year old, Italian born Guiseppina (Aurelia Eneide) encounters the painful realisation that she is living in a dual society.

results.title: Peel
results.brief_description: A red-headed family’s drive in the countryside begins an intrigue of awesome belligerence and obstinacy. This short student drama from the director of ‘The Piano’ (2003) was the winner of the Palme d’Or for best short film at Cannes in 1986. Original format 16 mm/colour.

group_siblings.title: The Two-wheeled time machine

results.title: The Hazzards: 1959-1983
results.brief_description:
The artists Charles and Sheena Hazzard offer through the lens of their 8mm camera, a unique historical film record of life in the Bundaberg region of Queensland. We see not only their family journeying through life but also their long-term commitment to art in the community.
In the triptych format, the narrator, Nicholas Hazzard (the youngest son) is seen concurrently as a baby, teenager and married with children. the notion of chronological time is disrupted and temporal montage is combined with spatial montage. Multilinear narratives occur across the three concurrent streams of video. Nicholas’ direct response to the footage presents a historical and geographical context on the Bundaberg region.

results.title: Mr Ikegami's flight
results.brief_description: Mr Ikegami is in Sydney on business. Back in Tokyo, his wife Seisuko is expecting their first child. A tale of divided loyalties. Features Kazuhiro Muroyama as Mr Ikegami. Japanese/English with English subtitles. Original format 35 mm
